data.name: Point in a polygon
data.description:
# Point in a Polygon
Given a 2d polygon description and a point coordinate, determine whether the point exists inside or outside the polygon.

The polygon may be simple or complex, and can include curves. The polygon description must be for a closed polygon, in which the first and last point
described are the same.

The polygon description will use two operators: moveto and lineto, similar to a subset of Postscript path operators.

'moveto' sets the current x y point

'lineto' draws a boundary to the next x y point, which becomes the new current x y point

A typical polygon descriptor
```javascript
  var thisPolygon = {'polygon' : [
		{'moveto' : {'x' : 10, 'y' : 10}},
		{'lineto' : {'x' : 20, 'y' : 10}},
		{'lineto' : {'x' : 20, 'y' : 20}},
		{'lineto' : {'x' : 10, 'y' : 20}},
		{'lineto' : {'x' : 10, 'y' : 10}}
	]}; ```

A typical point descriptor
```javascript
	var thisPoint = {'x' : 12, 'y' : 18}; ```

A good starting point for the point in polygon algorithm test can be found here: http://www.ecse.rpi.edu/Homepages/wrf/Research/Short_Notes/pnpoly.html
There are other examples as well. It will require that any curves be rendered into straight-line segments.

Given a polygon and a point, the pointInPoly function will return true if the point is in side the polygon, false if it is outside, or a string: 'Error!'
if the polygon is not closed properly. (This last because the Test.expectError() call does not seem to handle errors as stated.)
